trial_identification.studytitle: Cognitive Bias Modification (CBM) Via Imagery and Internet Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (iCBT) for Depression
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Internet Based Cognitive Behavioural Therapy for Major Depressive Disorder Plus a Cognitive Bias Modification Intervention (OxIGen)on Symptoms of Depression and Negative Interpretation Bias.

interventions.interventions:
Other interventions - CBM Other interventions - iCBT
Experimental: CBM Version A + iCBT - CBM Version A is an Internet-based intervention taking place over 1 week followed by iCBT, an Internet-based treatment for depression taking place over 10 weeks.
Placebo Comparator: CBM Version B (Control) + iCBT - CBM Version B (Control) is an Internet-based intervention taking place over 1 week (identical to CBM Version A without the putative active components) followed by iCBT, an Internet-based treatment for depression taking place over 10 weeks.
Other interventions: CBM CBM is an Internet-based intervention comprised of delivery of auditory scenarios taking place over 1 week.
Other interventions: iCBT iCBT is a validated online CBT treatment program for depression delivered in 6 lessons over 10 weeks.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at baseline (T1), post-CBM intervention (T2, 1 week after baseline), post iCBT intervention (8-10 weeks after baseline), and at 3 month follow-up (T4).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in Beck Depression Inventory - second edition (BDI-II)scores
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at baseline (T1), post-CBM intervention (T2, 1 week after baseline), post iCBT intervention (8-10 weeks after baseline), and at 3 month follow-up (T4).
Administered at baseline (T1), post-CBM intervention (T2, 1 week after baseline).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in diagnostic status (MINI5 depression module)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at baseline (T1), post iCBT intervention (8-10 weeks after baseline), and at 3 month follow-up (T4).

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at baseline (T1), post-CBM intervention (T2, 1 week after baseline), post iCBT intervention (8-10 weeks after baseline), and at 3 month follow-up (T4).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in WHO Disability Assessment Scale (WHO-DAS)scores
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at baseline (T1, post iCBT intervention (8-10 weeks after baseline), and at 3 month follow-up (T4).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in State Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)scores
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at baseline (T1), post iCBT intervention (8-10 weeks after baseline), and at 3 month follow-up (T4).
Administered at baseline (T1), post-CBM intervention (T2, 1 week after baseline), post iCBT intervention (8-10 weeks after baseline), and at 3 month follow-up (T4).
Administered at baseline (T1), post iCBT intervention (8-10 weeks after baseline), and at 3 month follow-up (T4).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Meet Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of the American Psychiatric Association - 4th edition (DSM-IV) criteria for Major Depressive Disorder
- Internet and printer access
- Australian resident
- Fluent in written and spoken English
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Current substance abuse/dependence
- Psychotic mental illness (Bipolar or Schizophrenia)
- Change in medication or psychological treatment during last 1 month or intended change during study duration
- Use of Benzodiazepines
- Severe depression (PHQ9> 23)
- Suicidal

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A randomised controlled trial comparing Internet based cognitive behavioural therapy for major depressive disorder plus a cognitive bias modification intervention (OxIGen) version A vs. Internet based cognitive behavioural therapy for major depressive disorder plus a cognitive bias modification intervention (OxIGen) version B on symptoms of depression and negative interpretation bias.
